job.title: Legal Analyst Attorney (34082)
job.description:

Job Title: Legal Analyst/Attorney with J.D.
Work Location: Hybrid, 2 days onsite/week at either of locations - Minneapolis, MN or Glastonbury, CT

Duration: 6+ month contract-to-Hire

  1. Juris Doctor (J.D.) degree.
  2. Ability to review documents.
  
JOB SUMMARY:
The Legal Invoice Analyst for client, Fulfilment Center of Excellence will be responsible for performing the quality assurance testing for the Legal Bill Analysis Center of Excellence (LBACOE).   
  
  • Understanding of legal terminology and claims legal situations, multijurisdictional exposure preferred.

job.title: Technical Support and Customer Service Associate (34264)
job.description:
Myticas Consulting is seeking a Bilingual (Spanish/English) Technical Support and Customer Service Associate to join our client’s Personal Support Center (PSC) team. This role is ideal for someone passionate about helping others, skilled in troubleshooting, and comfortable in a fast-paced, tech-forward environment.

What You’ll Do:

  • Provide Tier 1 technical support for software, hardware, and connectivity issues

  • Assist with password resets, software installations, VPN setups, and general troubleshooting

  • Escalate complex issues to senior team members when necessary

  • Maintain clear, professional communication in both Spanish and English across all customer interactions

  • Manage support requests via phone, email, and chat simultaneously

  • Accurately log cases in tools like ServiceNow and Zendesk

What We’re Looking For:

  • Fluency in Spanish and English (written and spoken)

  • Strong customer service and communication skills

  • Ability to quickly adapt to new tools, systems, and processes

  • Team-oriented with a willingness to learn and grow

  • Flexibility to work 1st or 2nd shift schedules

Why Join Us:

  • Hands-on training and mentoring

  • Access to a robust internal knowledge base

  • Opportunities to collaborate with tech experts and leadership

  • A supportive team environment that encourages growth

If you’re ready for a dynamic support role where no two days are the same, apply now or reach out to learn more.

job.title: Salesforce Media Cloud Solution Architect (34390)
job.description:
Salesforce Media Cloud Solutions Architect – Contract Opportunity
Remote U.S. | 12-Month Engagement | Start: January 2026
Myticas Consulting is seeking an experienced Salesforce Media Cloud Solutions Architect for a long-term consulting engagement. This is a hands-on leadership role for someone who thrives at the intersection of technology and business strategy, helping enterprise clients maximize their investment in Salesforce Media Cloud.
What You’ll Do

  • Translate business requirements into scalable Salesforce Media Cloud solutions (Ad Sales Management, Campaigns, Contracts, Placements).
  • Define and oversee solution architecture while ensuring alignment with Salesforce best practices.
  • Lead workshops, discovery sessions, and solution demos to validate and refine designs.
  • Drive cross-cloud strategy, integrating Media Cloud with Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, and Marketing Cloud.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders, product owners, and technical teams to ensure adoption and measurable business value.
  • Partner with Technical Architects to ensure technical feasibility and smooth delivery.
  • Support client adoption with documentation, training, and knowledge transfer.
What We’re Looking For
  • 7+ years of Salesforce ecosystem experience, including at least 2+ years with Media Cloud.
  • Proven success designing solutions across Ad Sales, Campaign Hierarchies, Media Plans, and Contract Lifecycle Management.
  • Expertise in Media Cloud data model, workflows, and core business processes.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Track record of leading solution design from requirements through delivery.
Preferred Experience
  • Leading Media Cloud discovery and solution workshops.
  • Familiarity with advanced Media Cloud features (inventory, forecasting, analytics).
  • Exposure to ad-tech/mar-tech integrations (FreeWheel, Google Ad Manager, Operative).
  • Agile/Scrum delivery experience.
  • Salesforce certifications such as Application Architect, Data Architect, or Industry Cloud Consultant.


This is a unique opportunity to shape enterprise-scale Media Cloud solutions while working with a dynamic team of Salesforce experts. If you’re a Salesforce Solutions Architect looking for your next consulting project, we want to hear from you!

job.title: Salesforce Media Cloud Technical Architect (34391)
job.description:
Salesforce Media Cloud Technical Architect – Contract Opportunity
Remote U.S. | 12-Month Engagement | Start: January 2026
Myticas Consulting is seeking a skilled Salesforce Media Cloud Technical Architect for a long-term consulting engagement. This is a hands-on technical leadership role where you’ll design, implement, and optimize Media Cloud solutions, ensuring scalability, integration, and performance across enterprise environments.
What You’ll Do

  • Lead the design and implementation of Salesforce Media Cloud solutions (Ad Sales Management, Campaigns, Contracts, Placements).
  • Define data models, system architecture, and integrations with ad servers, billing, and rights management platforms.
  • Drive cross-cloud integrations between Media Cloud, Service Cloud, and Marketing Cloud.
  • Establish technical best practices and mentor development teams.
  • Ensure compliance, scalability, and performance throughout the project lifecycle.
What We’re Looking For
  • 7+ years of Salesforce ecosystem experience, including 2+ years specifically with Media Cloud.
  • Proven, hands-on Media Cloud implementation expertise across Ad Sales, Campaign Hierarchies, Media Plans, and Contract Lifecycle Management.
  • Strong technical background in Apex, Lightning, SOQL, and Salesforce integrations (REST/SOAP).
  • Experience with Revenue Scheduling, Rate Cards, and Dynamic Pricing.
  • Deep knowledge of Salesforce data architecture, security, and performance optimization.
Preferred Experience
  • Familiarity with Salesforce DevOps tools (Gearset, Copado, Jenkins).
  • Agile/Scrum delivery experience.
  • Exposure to advanced Media Cloud features (inventory, forecasting, analytics).
  • Integrations with ad-tech/mar-tech platforms (FreeWheel, Google Ad Manager, Operative).


This is a high-impact consulting role where you’ll bring deep technical expertise to shape and deliver complex Salesforce Media Cloud solutions. If you’re a Technical Architect ready for your next big challenge, we’d love to connect.

job.title: Internal Audit Manager (P&C Insurance) — Part-Time, Remote (34438)
job.description:
Our Toronto client is looking for a part-time Internal Audit Manager to support regulatory and controls work for a Canadian P&C insurer. Engagement focuses on detailed control reviews, limited testing of complex controls, project management, and status reporting using a risk-based internal audit approach.

Must-Have Qualifications

  • Insurance sector experience with strong knowledge of OSFI regulations (P&C focused).

  • Hands-on internal audit experience (planning, execution, reporting) and control evaluation.

  • Familiarity with P&C products/processes and regulatory compliance requirements.

  • BAAT return experience (Business Activity Assessment Tool) — required.

  • Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.

Nice to Have

  • Professional designation (CIA, CPA, or equivalent).

  • Experience with audit methodologies/frameworks and risk management best practices.

Work Model

  • Remote delivery; up to two (2) on-site half-day visits at client’s downtown Toronto office.

job.title: SAP QM Lead (Manager Level) (34436)
job.description:
Our GTA client is looking for a senior SAP QM Lead for a contract opportunity which requires travel. The team will be delivering a large SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud program and needs a Manager-level SAP Quality Management (QM) Lead. You’ll own a focused QM scope (typically within Manufacturing/Production Execution) and provide functional leadership across design, build, and delivery in a client-facing role.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead SAP QM workstream across design, configuration, testing, and deployment in S/4HANA Private Cloud.

  • Define QM processes (inspection planning, results recording, usage decisions, quality notifications, vendor/customer QM integration) aligned to manufacturing/production execution.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (PP/PP-PI, MM, EWM, SD) to ensure end-to-end process integration.

  • Produce client-facing deliverables: solution designs, fit/gap, test strategy/scripts, cutover inputs, and hypercare support.

  • Provide day-to-day leadership, status, RAID management, and steer stakeholder alignment.

Must-Have Qualifications

  • Hands-on SAP QM expertise leading delivery on S/4HANA (Private Cloud preferred).

  • Strong integration experience with Manufacturing/Production Execution processes and adjacent modules (PP/PP-PI, MM, SD/EWM).

  • Proven client-facing leadership at manager level: workshops, design authority, and delivery governance.

Nice to Have

  • Sector experience in Mining & Metals or broader Energy.

  • Experience on large, multi-vendor S/4 programs.

job.title: High-Speed Analog Engineer (34434)
job.description:
Myticas is seeking a High-Speed Analog EDA/CAD Engineer with to support SiGE and CMOS research & development and chip design.

Description:
Seeking an High-Speed Analog EDA/CAD Engineer to support and develop SiGe and CMOS design solutions for the high speed analog ASIC design team. The engineer will be hands-on with all phases of tool flow including foundry interface, PDK installation and support, tool evaluation and installation, layout, archive and tapeout. The engineer must be an expert in analog and mixed-signal circuit design flows and tools. Tasks will include significant tool and PDK customization and design team support. The self-motivated engineer must be able to anticipate problems and devise effective solutions.
Responsibilities:
• Install, customize and support external vendor PDK’s for both SiGe and CMOS processes
• Install, customize and support Custom IC and RF CAD environment for the design of high-speed (10–40 Gb/s), broad-band, mixed-signal, integrated circuits for fiber-based wireline applications.
• Lead and contribute to the development of design standards, IC development processes, CAD tools and design flows.
• Execute and support layout efforts including archive and tapeout processes
Minimum Expertise Requirements:
• Expert in high-speed analog and mixed-signal IC design concepts and must demonstrate superior critical thinking skills, problem solving capabilities and engineering judgment.
• Fluent with analog EDA front and back end tools
o Cadence Virtuoso, ADE
o Strong SKILL programming a must
o Mentor Calibre (end user support and rule deck writing)
• Detailed understanding of advanced high-speed analog & mixed-signal layout concepts
• FlexLM license management
• Strong UNIX/Linux knowledge
• Not required but preferred
o Perforce
o Ocean scripting and advanced modelling and simulation knowledge
o Linux OS support
Minimum Experience Requirements:
• 5 years of experience working as a high-speed analog & mixed signal IC CAD professional is required
• IC Technologies: High-speed IC technologies, including CMOS and bipolar.
• IC Design Software:
o Experience with configuring, documenting, and maintaining high speed analog IC design flows is a must.
o Experience with transistor-level IC design and verification software, e.g. Cadence Composer, Cadence Virtuoso, Cadence Spectre, Virtuoso AMS, Mentor Calibre, Skill language, is a must.
• General understanding of digital physical design flows, e.g. RTL coding, place and route, DRC/LVS verification.
• Work Environment: Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment. Must be strong individual contributor, and also able to work as member of a small team. Must be able to support EPDA users and solve problems efficiently, effectively and rapidly.
Education Requirements:
• BS 5+ years
• MS 4+ years
• PhD 3+ year

$70-$100/hr. on W2 (Based upon experience)

job.title: RF Optimization Engineer (34443)
job.description:
Responsibilities:
• Coordinating with the drive test teams to make sure the drive tests are performed as per the plan and on time.
• Making sure all the CIQ data and Port Matrix Data and all other information needed to prepare SCFs is available on time.
• Follow the swap schedule on daily basis.
• Coordinate with teams, Project Management and the customer.
• Present daily, weekly swap updates to the customer in Daily/Weekly meetings.
• Maintain and update trackers for the sites that are swapped and the services delivered.
• Trigger the activities (SSV, SSS) at the right time once the swap is completed to ensure smooth running of the project.
• Investigate KPIs Quality of Service-related issues at Cell/Band/Site/Cluster Level.
• Login to the sites to check Alarms and Operations relates issues and convey them to the relevant teams.
• Evaluate the SSV/SSS/SSP reports before submitting them to the customer.
• Coordinate with GDC teams to make sure that error free reports are sent to the customer for their acceptance.
• Perform LTE/5G Parameter Audit and correlate the changes with any KPIs behavioral change.



• 5G Optimization experience covering Sub6 Optimization; DSS Optimization; mmWave Optimization; VONR, NSA, SA.
• Experience with Multi-Layer Cluster Optimization including 5G/LTE/UMTS.
• Performs RF performance activities in customer projects independently, according to project plan and in project managers guidance.
• Analysis of KPIs, investigation and improvement of network quality problems.
• Implementation of new features and tuning 5G/4G (LTE) radio network parameters.
• Experience with network performance management functions including trending, analysis, monitoring, reporting, and troubleshooting.
• Prior experience with 5G/LTE parameters, KPI counters, Operational Performance Indicator (OPI) counters, and associated call scenarios. Skills to review daily KPI reports and identify sites with performance degradation issues is required.
• Deep experience in network performance components and troubleshooting. Network performance problem detection and solution methods, e.g., throughput issues, drop call rates, access/rach failures etc. Have knowledge of tools including NetAct OSS , Web Element Manager, CM Editor, etc. creating reports and deep dive counter-based analysis.
• Understanding of Radio Resource Management functionalities, e.g., handover control, admission controls, capacity management, etc.
• Knowledge of running traces for troubleshooting/analysis. Must have knowledge of the various drive testing equipment such as JDSU/RAN Advisor, Nemo, TEMS, X-CAL, Windcatcher and FalconSmart.
• Experience with NetAct in alarm management, performance Suite management, and parameter configuration.

The following are desired/preferred
• Prior experience working with T-Mobile tools, OneData, Truecall, ActixOne, Atoll, Asset, IMNOS and RFDS.
• Hands-on experience and knowledge of TDD and FDD parameters.
• Knowledge in RF Optimization Layer 3 analysis experience using tools similar to ACTIX.
• Expertise in troubleshooting to perform tasks such as resetting an eNB/gNB/RRH, changing parameters, run XLM plans, alarms, RSSI issues
• Hands-on knowledge of monitoring site alarms, doing health check status of sites, and resolve alarms.

Education:
• MS in Electrical Engineering/Computer Science or other related Engineering. Bachelors with 10 or more years of experience also acceptable
• Strong teamwork, discipline to follow process, good communication and documentation skills. • Proficient in MS Office, especially Excel (formulas, running macros), MS PowerPoint.

Pay Range $35-$45/hr W2

job.title: Senior Network Architect (32577)
job.description:
We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Senior Network Architect with expertise in Segment Routing to join our dynamic and innovative team. As a Senior Network Architect, you will play a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and optimizing our network infrastructure, with a specific focus on segment routing technologies. Your deep understanding of network architecture, protocols, and best practices will contribute to the scalability, reliability, and performance of our network while ensuring alignment with business objectives.


The Sr. Network Architect is a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on all aspects of the LEO Network design and works with other LEO teams within Telesat and external contractors to ensure designs, implementation decisions, validation plans and documentation reflect the business requirements and objectives of the LEO program.

Main Responsibilities

  • Segment Routing Design and Implementation:
  • Participate in the design and implementation of segment routing solutions, ensuring optimal utilization of network resources and improved traffic engineering.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into effective network solution designs.
  • Develop strategies for partner business units to implement and manage network services implementations of segment routing architectures.
  • Network Architecture and Optimization:
  • Contribute to the architectural planning and evolution of the network, incorporating segment routing as a key technology.
  • Identify opportunities for optimization and enhanced performance using segment routing techniques, such as traffic steering, BSIDs and fast reroute mechanisms.
  • Perform network assessments and recommend improvements to maintain network health and operational efficiency.
  • Represent the LEO Network Engineering team by documenting and delivering network requirements to hardware and software development teams specifically in the areas of customer facing MEF 3.0 interface and networking design support requirements on data processing equipment
  • In coordination with Network team attend, contribute and produce materials for internal and external design and system engineering reviews for LEO Network Engineering related activities
  • Protocols and Standards:
  • Maintain a deep understanding of industry standards and protocols related to segment routing, such as IS-IS, BGP, and MPLS.
  • Stay updated with emerging trends and advancements in segment routing technologies, applying them to enhance network capabilities.
  • Troubleshooting and Problem Resolution:
  • Act as a subject matter expert, assist with complex network troubleshooting and incident resolution.
  • Collaborate with the LEO team to diagnose and address network behaviors and incidents in a timely manner, minimizing service disruptions.
  • Vendor and Solution Evaluation:
  • Evaluate new networking hardware, software, and solutions that align with segment routing strategies and network growth plans.
  • Collaborate with vendors to understand product roadmaps and provide feedback for feature enhancements.
  • Documentation and Knowledge Sharing:
  • Create and maintain detailed technical documentation, including network diagrams, configuration guidelines, and troubleshooting procedures related to segment routing.
  • Prepare and deliver materials including presentations, reference documentation and test strategies for LEO network equipment and applications deployment and operation
  • Share knowledge and mentor junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development.
  • With LEO Network Engineers develop and oversee plans including product idea investigations, proof of concept, Service validation and product demonstrations in Telesat LEO labs

Education and Experience

  • 10+ years of experience in carrier network design, operation and deployment
  • Broad experience or exposure across all areas of network related product design, development, verification, deployment and support
  • Understanding of Metro Ethernet Forum (MEF) standards and objectives as they relate to Carrier Ethernet Services.
  • Knowledge of routing and switching protocols, including BGP, OSPF, IS-IS, and MPLS.
  • Experience with network automation and scripting using tools such as Python, Ansible, or similar.
  • Strong troubleshooting skills and the ability to diagnose and resolve complex network issues.
  • Demonstrated leadership skills and the ability to guide and mentor junior engineers.
  • In-depth understanding of security principles and practices as they relate to network architecture.
  • Proven experience in network design, architecture, and optimization.
  • Professional certifications such as Cisco CCIE, Juniper JNCIE, or equivalent, are highly desirable.
  • Comfortable leading meetings and able to communicate issues and trends to senior management and other groups at the appropriate level of detail.
  • Excellent communication (verbal, written, presentation) and interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration abilities, with a proven track record of working effectively within cross-functional teams.
  • Communicates well with own team and across organizational boundaries to ensure the successful completion of shared goals.

job.title: Field Application Engineer (34409)
job.description:
Myticas is seeking a highly skilled Field Application Engineer (FAE) to join our client. In this role, you will act as the primary technical liaison between customers and our headquarters in Korea, focusing on resolving PCB-related quality issues and addressing technical inquiries. You will be responsible for on-site customer communication, coordinating with HQ engineering and quality teams, and providing clear explanations and solutions to ensure customer satisfaction. This position requires strong technical expertise, excellent communication skills, and the ability to manage complex quality and technical challenges in a global environment.
Key Responsibilities
  • Serve as the first point of contact for PCB quality issues and technical inquiries at customer sites
  • Communicate effectively with customers to explain issue status, root cause, corrective actions, and technical solutions
  • Collaborate closely with HQ engineering and quality teams in Korea to perform Root
  • Cause Analysis (RCA) and develop corrective measures
  • Provide technical guidance and answers to customer questions related to PCB
design, manufacturing, and reliability
  • Prepare and deliver technical reports, quality summaries, and presentations for
customers
  • Support customer audits, quality reviews, and technical workshops as needed
  • Collect customer feedback and share insights with internal teams for continuous
improvement
  • Monitor industry trends and competitive solutions related to PCB quality and technology
Required Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Electronics, or related field
  • 7–10+ years of experience in PCB design, manufacturing processes, or quality engineering
  • Strong understanding of PCB design tools (Altium, Cadence, Mentor) and
manufacturing processes
  • Proven experience in quality issue resolution, RCA, and technical troubleshooting
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills for customer-facing interactions
  • Ability to work collaboratively with teams and manage multiple priorities
  • Willingness to travel within North America

Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience with signal integrity (SI), power integrity (PI), and high-speed PCB design
  • Knowledge of industry standards (IPC, ISO) and quality certifications
  • Familiarity with semiconductor packaging or advanced PCB technologies
  • Programming or scripting knowledge (Python, C/C++, Shell scripting)
  • Project management or leadership experience
  • Strong customer-oriented mindset and problem-solving skills

job.title: Data Science & Network Modeling (34373)
job.description:
The team at Myticas Consulting is seeking a Product Owner – Data Science & Network Modelling with deep expertise in network data modelling (especially IETF YANG), machine learning, and business analysis. This role is ideal for someone who can translate complex technical challenges into actionable product strategies, enabling data-driven decision-making across satellite and ground network systems.

You will design scalable data models and machine learning pipelines, apply ML techniques in cloud environments, and work closely with stakeholders to prioritize features and align product development with business needs. As the key link between technical teams and strategic objectives, you’ll define and own the roadmap for data-centric solutions that drive operational efficiency and innovation.

Main Responsibilities

  • Own the end-to-end product lifecycle for data-driven features and models—from ideation through development, deployment, and iteration.

  • Design and oversee the development of scalable data models, with a focus on network data standards such as IETF YANG.

  • Translate business needs into clear data product requirements, ensuring alignment between stakeholders, technical teams, and strategic goals.

  • Define and prioritize product roadmaps, user stories, and backlogs in collaboration with engineering, data science, and business teams.

  • Develop and support machine learning pipelines for tasks like anomaly detection, predictive maintenance, and performance optimization.

  • Apply statistical and analytical methods (e.g., regression, clustering, outlier detection) to extract insights and support business decisions.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, ML researchers, domain experts, and executives, to deliver impactful solutions.

  • Validate and measure the success of data initiatives using relevant KPIs, A/B testing, and performance tracking frameworks.

  • Ensure data governance, quality, and compliance throughout the modeling and product development process.

  • Act as a subject matter expert on data modeling and ML applications within cloud off-the-shelf solutions and complex network infrastructures.

  • Develop and maintain YANG models for telemetry and configuration data from satellite and terrestrial networks.

  • Design data models to support anomaly detection, predictive analytics, and network optimization.

  • Use data modeling tools to extract insights from high-volume telemetry data.

  • Build real-time and batch data pipelines using Apache Kafka, Spark, and Google Dataflow.

  • Deploy ML pipelines in cloud and hybrid environments.

  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather requirements, define KPIs, and align data initiatives with strategic goals.

  • Translate complex technical findings into clear business insights and visualizations.

  • Support data governance, lineage, and metadata integration across the data lifecycle.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or a related technical field.

  • 5+ years of experience in data science, data modeling, or cloud-based machine learning, with at least 2 years in a product owner or technical leadership role.

  • Strong experience in network data modeling, especially using IETF YANG or similar data modeling languages.

  • Proficient in machine learning frameworks and in building ML pipelines in production environments.

  • Hands-on experience with statistical methods such as regression, classification, clustering, and outlier detection.

  • Familiarity with cloud platforms and data engineering tools (e.g., Spark, Kafka, Airflow).

  • Demonstrated ability to translate business needs into technical requirements, and to manage a backlog and product roadmap.

  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with experience working cross-functionally between technical and non-technical teams.

  • Experience with Agile methodologies, including sprint planning, backlog grooming, and user story definition.

  • Strong understanding of data governance, privacy, and security best practices in complex or regulated environments.

  • Experience defining or contributing to organization-wide AI strategy or governance frameworks.

  • Knowledge of AI/ML infrastructure at scale, including MLOps tools and model monitoring strategies.

  • Experience managing AI use case prioritization across multiple business domains.

  • Experience with NETCONF, RESTCONF, or gNMI (Preferred).

  • Knowledge of event-driven architectures and real-time analytics.

job.title: Director, Government Business Development & Proposals (34332)
job.description:
Location: Remote (Canada)
Type: Full-time, Permanent

About the Role
Our client, a global leader in advanced technology solutions, is seeking a Director of Business Development (Government Contracts). This role will spearhead expansion into federal, provincial, state, and international government markets. You’ll lead the full lifecycle of government proposals, build strategic partnerships, and secure funding/contracts that support climate action and space innovation.

What You’ll Do
  • Develop and execute a government contracting strategy.
  • Identify, qualify, and pursue opportunities with agencies (CSA, ESA, NASA, DoD, ECCC, etc.).
  • Lead government proposal writing and management (RFI, RFP, RFQ, grants, tenders).
  • Build and maintain trusted relationships with public sector stakeholders.
  • Negotiate teaming agreements and subcontractor partnerships.
  • Provide pipeline analysis and capture strategy updates to leadership.


What We’re Looking For
  • 8–10+ years of business development/proposal management in aerospace, defense, cleantech, or government contracting.
  • Proven track record leading winning multi-million-dollar proposals.
  • Familiarity with procurement systems (MERX, Buyandsell.gc.ca, SAM.gov, ESA EMITS, NASA NSPIRES).
  • Strong persuasive writing, capture management, and negotiation skills.
  • Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s or APMP certification is an asset.

Why This Role?
Join a mission-driven organization that leverages cutting-edge technology to make global impact, while shaping strategy at the intersection of environment, defense, and innovation.

job.title: Senior ASIC Product Engineer (34268)
job.description:
Myticas is seeking a highly skilled and motivated ASIC Product Engineer to join our clients team. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing specifications and validation methods for Analog ASICs used in datacenter transceiver products. This role involves close collaboration with multiple teams on product definition, requirements, specifications, DVT, qualification, test, and production ramp-up. The ideal candidate will be proactive, able to anticipate problems, and devise effective solutions.
 

 
HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE AND WHAT YOU WILL LEARN
  • Translate system requirements for datacenter communication ICs into detailed specifications and ensure compliance through design, test, and validation processes.
  • Develop and maintain application notes to support the integration of these ICs.
  • Serve as the liaison between the ASIC design team and module-level HW integration and test teams.
  • Drive the supply of prototype ASICs for performance and reliability validation activities.
  • Perform statistical data analysis on large datasets to characterize and improve product performance.
  • Track, troubleshoot, and resolve IC issues in collaboration with the design team.
  • Evaluate capabilities, yields, and supply planning in preparation for volume ramp following product release.
KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
  • Proven experience in product engineering, working cross-functionally to bring ASICs to market through multiple development cycles.
  • Experience working with analog ASICs with proven ability to evaluate performance and lead failure analysis
  • Strong understanding of device physics and its impact on analog circuits, with techniques to improve performance.
  • Proficiency in working with large datasets, performing statistical analysis, and presenting data and ideas to diverse audiences.
  • Excellent organizational and information management skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to enhance proficiency through programming skills and process development.
Salary Range 139,000 - 260,000

job.title: SAP Transportation Management (TM) Functional Consultant (34411)

Key Responsibilities

  • Set up and govern TM master data (locations, resources, lanes, etc.).

  • Deliver TM Delivery-Based Integration with S/4HANA (O2C/P2P flows).

  • Configure Freight Costing & Settlement (agreements, charges, conditions).

  • Partner with business/IT to capture requirements, produce FS/CS, test (SIT/UAT), and support cutover/hypercare.

  • Collaborate on 3rd-party TMS integrations (e.g., Uber Freight) where applicable.

  • Provide client stakeholder management and status reporting.

Must-Have Qualifications

  • 10+ years hands-on SAP TM functional experience.

  • Proven delivery in: Freight Order Management, TM master data, TM–S/4 Delivery-Based Integration, Freight Costing & Settlement.

  • SAP TM certification (required).

  • Excellent client-facing communication and documentation skills.

Nice to Have

  • Experience integrating SAP TM with Uber Freight or other 3rd-party TMS platforms.

  • Prior work in hybrid enterprise environments (S/4HANA).

Work Model

job.title: SAP OTC Functional Consultant (34403)
job.description:
Our EIM, Toronto based client is looking for a hands-on SAP OTC specialist with hands on expertise in the areas of Order management, Billing, Integrations with Salesforce, etc. for a long term remote contract opportunity.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead/configure SAP OTC processes end-to-end (order entry  billing collections).

  • Design & optimize order management and billing flows; resolve production issues.

  • Coordinate and support SAP Salesforce integration for orders/customer data.

  • Prepare functional specs, test scenarios, and support UAT & go-live.

  • Analyze OTC KPIs and produce reports to support decision-making.

Salesforce, etc.

 

Qualifications:

·       10-15 years of experience in Order to Cash (OTC) processes and systems, demonstrating a deep understanding of the end-to-end OTC cycle.

·       Must have proven expertise in SAP OTC processes, including order management, billing, invoicing, and collections.

·       Must have certification in SAP OTC or related modules, showcasing formal recognition of skills and knowledge in this area.

 

Technical Skills:

·       SAP ECC:

o   Extensive experience with SAP ECC (Enterprise Central Component), particularly in configuring and optimizing OTC functionalities.

o   Ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues within the SAP OTC module effectively.

·       Salesforce Integration:

o   Basic knowledge of Salesforce, particularly in how it integrates with SAP for order management and customer relationship management.

o   Experience in managing data flows between SAP and Salesforce, ensuring seamless operations.

 

Additional Skills:

·       Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and address issues within the OTC process.

·       Ability to analyze data and generate reports to support decision-making.

·       Familiarity with the software and cloud services industry, particularly in relation to content management and data solutions.

·       Understanding of business AI and cybersecurity tools as they relate to OTC processes.

job.title: Tech Writer (34298)
job.description:
Our client is looking for a Senior Technical Writer to support the Project Management Office on the Government of Canada’s S/4HANA transformation. The role will build a consistent documentation framework and produce high-quality project/technical artifacts used to compete and manage work with a Team of Qualified Suppliers (TQS).

Responsibilities

  • Design and deliver a document intake/process for project aligned to GoC/industry standards.

  • Author, edit, and format key documents (e.g., SOWs, DIDs, CDRLs, TCRs, TWPs, SORs) and related templates.

  • Partner with clients technical authorities to gather requirements, standardize nomenclature, and ensure cross-document consistency.

  • Provide QA on structure, grammar, compliance, task sequencing, and interdependencies across artifacts/work packages.

  • Maintain version control and update documentation based on feedback/spec changes.

  • Prepare weekly and monthly status reports, agendas/minutes, and support change/control communications.

  • Coordinate smooth transition of documents through review/approval and repository standards (Microsoft Office/SharePoint).

Must-Have Qualifications

  • University degree/college diploma in business administration, communications, or related field.

  • 5+ years as a Technical Writer on complex programs (Gov’t/regulated preferred).

  • Demonstrated experience producing SOW, DID, CDRL and similar artifacts to DND/GoC standards.

  • Strong stakeholder facilitation; ability to prioritize and meet deadlines across multiple concurrent tasks.

  • Advanced MS Word/Excel/PowerPoint; comfortable with structured templates and style guides.

Nice to Have

  • Familiarity with:

    • TBS/DND standards (e.g., DAOD, C-01-100-100/AG-006/008, D-01-300-100, CAF SOR/SOW guidance).

    • ERP/SAP program documentation (S/4HANA context).

  • Experience establishing documentation governance (templates, intake, KPI dashboards, RAID/action logs).

Work Model & Deliverables

  • Primarily virtual, with escorted access to DND facilities if required.

  • Key deliverables include: intake process, template suite (SOW/DID/CDRL/etc.), weekly and monthly reports, agendas/minutes, and finalized documents per approved templates.

job.title: Senior Quantitative Software Developer (34352)
job.description:
About the Role

We are seeking two highly skilled Quantitative Software Developers to join our team on a contract basis. These consultants will play a critical role in enhancing our stress testing framework, contributing to model validation, development, and optimization initiatives within a leading Canadian financial institution.
This is a hands-on technical role, ideal for senior developers with deep expertise in programming, quantitative finance, and econometrics who can contribute immediately to high-impact projects.

Key Responsibilities
  • Develop and enhance functionalities within the firm’s stress testing framework.
  • Lead and contribute to code optimization efforts to improve efficiency, scalability, and performance.
  • Support the validation and development of financial models, ensuring accuracy and compliance with internal and regulatory standards.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including model risk, validation, and development teams.
  • Provide subject matter expertise on quantitative methodologies and programming best practices.
Qualifications
  • 10+ years of relevant experience in software development and quantitative finance.
  • Must qualify for Government of Canada Security Clearance (Minimum 5 years of living in Canada)
  • Proven track record working with large financial institutions in Canada (e.g., six D-SIBs or equivalent).
  • Advanced programming skills, with deep expertise in Java and Python (additional languages a plus).
  • Strong background in quantitative finance, econometrics, and model development/validation.
  • Experience contributing to large-scale risk management or stress testing frameworks.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
Contract Details
  • Term: 6 months (possibility of extension)
  • Location: Remote, Canada-based candidates only
  • Start Date: Targeting early October 2025
If you are an experienced Quantitative Developer with a strong background in financial modeling and programming, we encourage you to apply and help drive critical risk management initiatives.

job.title: S4 HANA Migration Architect (34333)
job.description:
Our client is launching a 2–2.5 year SAP ECC ? S/4HANA modernization. The S/4HANA Migration Architect will provide leadership across design, migration strategy, testing readiness, and stakeholder alignment to ensure a smooth transition to a cloud-based S/4HANA environment with no disruption to business operations.

Key Responsibilities

  • Advise on strategy, approach, and risks for the ECC to S/4HANA migration across Finance, Procurement, Supply Chain, HCM, and Facilities.

  • Partner with IT and third-party vendors to design and execute the migration plan; review solution designs, migration waves, and program plans to identify gaps and optimizations.

  • Provide thought leadership and coach program team members; promote transparent, problem-solving culture.

  • Guide/validate test plans & test cases leveraged during S/4HANA testing (incl. integration/UAT).

  • Facilitate communication across stakeholders and technology partners; identify & mitigate risks.

  • Support RFPs, business cases, OCM activities; prepare executive-ready documents, reports, and presentations.

  • Analyze complex problems and develop integrated, innovative solutions aligned to program goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • Extensive hands-on experience leading large-scale ECC ? S/4HANA migrations spanning multiple domains (Finance, Procurement, Supply Chain, HCM).

  • Bachelor’s degree in business/engineering/science (or equivalent).

  • 10+ years delivering complex programs with large teams, budgets, and executive stakeholders; experience on transformations >$10M.

  • SME depth relevant to large ERP implementations; proven ability to navigate competing priorities and deadlines, maintain project artifacts, and present to executives.

  • Strong communicator with the ability to build trust across business and IT; advanced written and verbal English.

  • Proficient with Microsoft Visio, Excel, PowerPoint.

Assets (Nice to Have)

  • Experience in regulated and/or unionized environments.

  • Work on new product/process introductions during ERP transformations.

  • Experience working in Agile teams.

job.title: FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer, Intermediate (3 Positions) (34259)
job.description:
FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer
 

We are seeking an FPGA/Hardware Engineer to help design and optimize advanced media transport and processing systems for high-performance video, audio, and data applications. This role involves hands-on design, testing, and support of production-grade solutions.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop FPGA-based solutions for video/audio transport and real-time processing (SMPTE ST 2110/IP, SDI).

  • Implement and optimize RTL designs, with a focus on 4K performance, data compression, and parallel processing.

  • Support hardware testing, debugging, and validation in lab environments.

  • Contribute to new product introduction (NPI) through design, documentation, and test activities.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams on requirements, component selection, and technical documentation.

What We’re Looking For

  • 2+ years of FPGA or hardware design experience (video/audio focus preferred).

  • Hands-on experience with Intel and/or Xilinx FPGA platforms and design tools.

  • Proficiency with SystemVerilog (preferred), VHDL, or HLS; scripting in TCL/SDC.

  • Familiarity with high-speed interfaces (Ethernet, DDR), transceivers, and timing analysis.

  • Strong problem-solving, debugging, and communication skills.

Nice to Have

  • Exposure to Linux-based development and programming in C/C++ or Python.

  • Knowledge of digital video/audio standards (SDI, AES, NMOS) and broadcast workflows.

  • Experience with packet processing, routing protocols, or PTP synchronization.

job.title: Senior, FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer (2 Positions) (34260)
job.description:
Senior FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer

We’re looking for a seasoned FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer to help architect and deliver next-generation solutions for high-performance video and data applications. This role involves taking projects from concept through to production, with a strong focus on efficiency, optimization, and real-time system performance.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead FPGA and hardware design efforts, from architecture through testing and validation.

  • Define requirements, select components, and contribute to schematic/board design decisions.

  • Develop, verify, and debug FPGA-based solutions (including UHD-SDI, high-speed transceivers, DDR interfaces, etc.).

  • Support the full product development lifecycle (design, QA, documentation, customer-facing support).

  • Collaborate across teams to ensure high-performance, production-ready solutions.

What You Bring

  • Strong background in RTL design and FPGA development (VHDL/Verilog).

  • Experience with real-time operating systems (RTOS), ideally in video, audio, or image processing.

  • Proven ability in high-volume data processing, compression, and parallel processing for 4K optimization.

  • Hands-on expertise with modern FPGA platforms (Xilinx, Intel/Altera) and related tools.

  • Familiarity with SoC integration, clock domain analysis, and timing closure.

  • Solid understanding of circuit design (power, signal integrity, microprocessor design).

  • Proficiency in debugging with lab tools (oscilloscopes, analyzers, WFMs, etc.).

  • Additional experience with C/C++/Java, scripting, and broadcast workflows is a plus.

job.title: Senior High-Speed Analog IC Design R&D Engineer (34222)
job.description:
You will be responsible for the development of integrated circuits operating at speeds greater than 100Gbaud for next-generation products. This role involves driving multiple aspects of IC product development, including circuit design, physical layout, and silicon bring-up. You will collaborate closely with teams across verification, CAD, product engineering, and test engineering to create and execute detailed design validation test (DVT) plans and device characterization strategies.

KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Minimum Experience Requirements:

  • Proven experience in high-speed analog IC design using SiGe BiCMOS or CMOS technologies

  • Strong understanding of transmission lines and other high-frequency passive components

  • Solid grasp of device physics and its influence on analog circuit performance, along with techniques to optimize performance

  • Hands-on experience with RF wafer probing, lab instrumentation, and evaluation of high-speed analog ICs

  • Familiarity with Verilog-A and scripting languages such as Skill, Python, or shell scripts is an asset

  • Excellent teamwork, verbal, and written communication skills

Education Requirements:

  • BS with 5+ years of relevant experience

  • MS with 3+ years of relevant experience

  • PhD with related academic or professional experience


    Salary Range:  $130,000 - $260,000

job.title: SAP S4 Business Analyst (34331)
job.description:
Our client is preparing for an SAP S/4HANA transformation and needs an experienced SAP Business Analyst to lead discovery and documentation of current-state processes across multiple functions and support migration-readiness activities.

What you’ll do

  • Run workshops to identify and document current business processes that leverage SAP ECC across Supply Chain, HCM, Finance, Procurement, and Facilities.

  • Develop strategies & templates to map processes consistently at the right level of detail for migration assessment.

  • Document current-state processes including roles/responsibilities and role headcount.

  • Analyze processes to identify gaps and optimization opportunities.

  • Partner with business & 3rd-party vendors to help document future-state processes where required.

  • Create test plans & test cases for UAT in SAP S/4HANA.

Required experience

  • Proven BA experience on SAP ECC programs, with exposure to S/4HANA initiatives.

  • Strong facilitation and documentation skills (workshops, process maps, RACI/roles).

  • Hands-on in writing UAT plans/test cases and driving user testing.

  • Excellent stakeholder communication across business and IT.

Nice to have

  • Background in ECC-S/4 migration assessments.

  • Familiarity with tools like Visio/ARIS, Azure DevOps/Jira, Solution Manager/ChaRM.

  • Public sector or healthcare experience.

Work model & compliance

job.title: Data Consultant (Engineer / Architect) (34457)
job.description:
Our client is seeking an experienced Data Consultant with expertise in both Data Architecture and Data Engineering. The ideal candidate will assess the current data landscape, define the As-Is and To-Be state, and design practical solutions and roadmaps that enhance automation, integration, and reporting capabilities across the organization.
This is a hands-on, delivery-focused role—ideal for someone who can architect, engineer, and optimize modern data ecosystems end-to-end.

Key Responsibilities:
• Assess existing data platforms, pipelines, and reporting processes to define As-Is and To-Be architectures.
• Design and implement scalable data frameworks and roadmaps supporting analytics and automation.
• Build and optimize data pipelines, ETL processes, and integrations using SQL, Informatica, and related tools.
• Drive automation and process optimization to improve data reliability and performance.
• Enable and enhance self-service analytics and visualization with Power BI and/or Tableau.
• Collaborate with stakeholders to align data initiatives with business goals.
• Improve data flow (“openflows”) and ensure transparency across systems.

Required Experience:
• 7+ years of experience in Data Architecture and Data Engineering roles.
• Strong skills in SQL, Informatica, and modern ETL / data integration tools.
• Proven ability to define and implement data roadmaps and modernize legacy environments.
• Hands-on experience with Power BI and/or Tableau for dashboards and reporting.
• Demonstrated success in driving automation and data lifecycle optimization.

Nice to Have:
• Knowledge of cloud data platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
• Experience in metadata management, data governance, or data quality frameworks.
• Familiarity with CI/CD, DevOps, or DataOps practices for pipeline automation.

job.title: Accounting Manager (34399)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client, based in Riverwoods, IL or Philadelphia, PA, is currently seeking a Accounting Manager for a hybrid contract to hire position.

 

Additional Information:  W2 only!

  • Hybrid position - 2 to 3 days per week onsite, open to candidates local to Philadelphia, PA or Riverwoods, IL
  • This is a Temp-to-Hire Position 

Job Description:

The Accounting Manager plays a critical role in overseeing the accounting and financial reporting functions, ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and compliance with internal controls. This position requires a detail-oriented, analytical thinker with strong leadership capabilities and the ability to navigate complex accounting scenarios proactively.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Lead and support the month-end close and reporting process in alignment with the reporting calendar.
• Supervise and mentor accounting staff, providing guidance, performance feedback, and support to improve processes — including the quality of account reconciliations.
• Review, analyze, and approve general ledger transactions to ensure completeness and accuracy.
• Oversee the preparation and review of balance sheet account reconciliations on a monthly, quarterly, and semi-annual basis.
• Proactively identify and resolve accounting issues, escalating, when necessary, with recommended solutions.
• Support internal and external audits by providing requested documentation and addressing inquiries professionally.
• Maintain and update desktop procedures and checklists to reflect changes in processes and tools.
• Maintain and monitor month-end close, reporting, and operational checklists to ensure timely and complete task execution before sign-off.
• Prepare and review supporting schedules and financial analyses as needed.
• Collaborate effectively with internal teams and third-party service providers to ensure smooth operations.
• Conduct independent analysis to identify opportunities for process improvement and implement recommendations.
• Support the timely research and resolution of reconciling items to ensure accuracy and compliance with deadlines.
• Demonstrate adaptability to changing business requirements and provide leadership and support to staff during transitions.
• Take initiative in identifying issues and opportunities, follow through on projects, and proactively recommend solutions to improve processes and resolve challenges.

Required Qualifications/Experience/Skills: 
• 7–9 years of accounting/audit experience, including 2–3 years in a managerial role.
• Ideal candidates must have current or recent (within the past 1–2 years) experience managing teams responsible for core general ledger functions. This includes hands-on oversight of month-end close, journal entry preparation and review, balance sheet and bank reconciliations, intercompany transactions, and audit support.
• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting (BBA or BS); Master’s degree preferred.
• CPA certification or progress toward certification strongly preferred.

A strong and recent focus on GL is required to be considered for this role:
• Experience with international accounting is a plus.
• Proficiency in major ERP systems (SAP, Great Plains, NetSuite) and Blackline.
• Advanced skills in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access).
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a detail-oriented approach.
• Proven ability to manage teams and work independently in a fast-paced environment.
• Comfortable working with accelerated month-end close timelines (3–5 days).
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to foster cross-functional collaboration.
• Project management experience is highly desirable.
• Flexibility to work hybrid hours and coordinate effectively during close/reporting cycles.

job.title: MLOps Consultant, Senior (34474)
job.description:
Overview
Our client, a leading organization in the banking sector, is seeking a Senior MLOps Consultant with deep technical expertise in Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) and Generative AI (GenAI) to support the design, deployment, and optimization of scalable ML solutions. This is a coding-intensive, hands-on consulting role that requires strong proficiency in containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes (K8s), and experience working within secure enterprise environments.
Key Responsibilities

  • Design, implement, and optimize end-to-end MLOps pipelines for training, testing, deploying, and monitoring ML/AI models.
  • Build and maintain scalable CI/CD processes for ML workflows, ensuring automation and reproducibility.
  • Develop and deploy GenAI solutions and frameworks to support business use cases.
  • Collaborate with Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Cloud Architects to ensure reliable and secure model operations.
  • Manage containerized ML workloads using Docker and Kubernetes, ensuring optimal performance and resource utilization.
  • Integrate ML pipelines with cloud infrastructure and enterprise data systems.
  • Troubleshoot, tune, and improve model serving and monitoring processes.
  • Contribute to best practices, documentation, and governance standards across the ML lifecycle.
Required Skills & Experience
  • 7+ years of hands-on experience in software engineering, data engineering, or DevOps with a focus on MLOps.
  • Strong proficiency in Python (coding heavy role – must be comfortable writing and optimizing production-grade code).
  • Solid understanding of ML lifecycle management, model versioning, and reproducibility principles.
  • Expertise with Docker, Kubernetes, and container orchestration for ML workloads.
  • Practical experience with GenAI frameworks (e.g., LangChain, Hugging Face, OpenAI APIs, etc.).
  • Familiarity with CI/CD tools (GitLab CI, Jenkins, ArgoCD, etc.) and cloud ML platforms (AWS Sagemaker, GCP Vertex AI, or Azure ML).
  • Previous experience working in the banking or financial services sector is highly desirable.
  • Excellent problem-solving, communication, and stakeholder-management skills.

job.title: Mechanical Engineering Manager (34472)
job.description:
Mechanical Engineering Manager
Denver, Colorado
Direct Hire
Salary range: $150-185K

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Engineering Manager will lead, develop, and continuously improve the engineering and design team to complete engineering & design efforts towards project design, engineering, procurement, drafting, and product life cycle management of large scale manufactured industrial equipment. 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Lead the engineering team on selecting and sizing equipment for fluid handling systems such as pumps, piping, valves, instrumentation, etc.   
  • Direct team to create 3D SolidWorks layouts (general arrangements), P&IDs, structural drawings, mechanical assembly drawings, and others as needed to support the production floor.  
  • Coordinate with the manufacturing shop on all fabricated, pre-assembled, and manufactured system designs.
  • Technical resource and decision-making authority to guide designs for safety, manufacturability, reliability, and within budgets. 
  • Act as an independent project manager of key accounts as required.
  • Select engineered equipment to be used in engineered product design.
  • Review/ create project proposals that accurately depict offerings to our client.
  • Proficient at guiding facility layouts due to maintenance, reliability, and serviceability needs.
  • Review mechanical and electrical manufacturing for accuracy and intended function based on the project design.
  • Liaison between the engineering/ design team and the production team
  • Coordinate material take-offs for purchase of all materials required for fabrication and installation of provided prefabricated and unitized systems.
  • Ability to review industry documents to guide designs, including ASME, ANSI, NEC, NFPA, ASTM, customer specifications, and further as required.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
  • Bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering or technical engineering, math, or science is required.
  • 5+ plus years of experience with each of the following:                  
    • Engineering design
    • Engineering management role with direct reports
    • Oil & gas surface equipment
    • Mechanical systems and associated components (i.e. pumps, piping, and instrumentation)
    • Working as an independent project manager
    •  SolidWorks
  • EIT registration is preferred.
  • Experience developing/ reviewing drawings for manufacturing of industrial equipment is required
  • SolidWorks and AutoCAD, 3D, 2D drafting experience beyond a basic level is required.
  • Experience with selection and specification of engineered equipment is required
  • Mechanical aptitude and hands-on experience is strongly preferred.
  • Microsoft Office proficiency
  • Proactive communicator that manages customer and vendor relationships.
  • Effective time management skills, personal conduct, and change management abilities.
  • Ability to lead a team of engineers and provide mentorship for individual technical and organization growth.

job.title: Network Sales Specialist (34475)
job.description:
Network Sales Specialist (Entry-Level | Optical Networking)

Location: Canada (Hybrid or Remote)

Our client is seeking a results-driven and tech-savvy individual eager to learn how to turn complex technology into customer success stories. As a Network Sales Specialist, you’ll help drive the client’s growth in optical networking by combining sales strategy with technical insight.

Key Responsibilities

  • Drive Growth: Work with field sales teams to understand customer challenges and position the client’s networking solutions to close deals.

  • Support Sales Execution: Develop business case tools, ROI models, and visual aids (network diagrams, configuration tools) that demonstrate clear customer value.

  • Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Partner with sales engineers, product managers, and marketing to create and execute winning go-to-market strategies.

  • Deliver Impactful Presentations: Educate customers through technical demos that highlight the performance and ROI of the client’s solutions.

What You’ll Gain

  • Technical Mastery: Build deep knowledge of cutting-edge optical and wireless networking solutions that power the internet.

  • Sales Development: Learn consultative sales techniques, from discovery and solution design to negotiation and close.

  • Career Growth: Gain high visibility across internal teams and customers—positioning yourself for future leadership in sales or technology.

What We’re Looking For

  • Passion for technology and the ability to simplify complex concepts.

  • Excellent communication, presentation, and teamwork skills.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, Engineering, or related field.

  • 0–2 years of professional experience, or equivalent academic/internship exposure.

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office; familiarity with Salesforce, Excel ROI models, or Visio is an asset.

Nice to Have

  • Previous tech sales or customer support experience.

  • Exposure to optical networking or related technology.

  • Sales certification (e.g., PPS, USCA) or participation in recognized sales competitio

job.title: Manufacturing Engineer - Contract to Hire (34476)
job.description:
Manufacturing Engineer
Contract to Hire
Grand Rapids, Michigan

Clover Consulting, a Myticas Co., is seeking a Manufacturing Engineer to be an Associate to the Senior Manufacturing Engineer.  In this position, you will lead and provide ongoing support through our manufacturing life cycle!

This is a 12 month contract opportunity, with great likelihood for Contract to Hire. This is a first shift position, hours are 7am to 4pm.

What You Will Be Doing:
With general direction, will lead the introduction of new products into the facility, improve productivity and profitability of existing production procedures, and provide ongoing support through the manufacturing life cycle. Acts as a technical expert in process technology

Improvements: Independently, with innovation and creativity, evaluates manufacturing processes to ensure optimal labor and material costs to increase productivity and profitability. Through justifications and evaluations, identifies prime areas for improvement. Tracks expenditures to ensure outlays are within budgeted amounts. Identifies, reduces, and eliminates worker exposure(s) to ergonomic stress(es) in the work place.

Floor Support: Provides timely product and process support for any manufacturing area to diagnose problems and implement solutions to minimize interruptions to production.

Special Projects: Leads the implementation of significant product, process, or other corporate change initiatives being introduced into the plant.

Strategic/Manufacturing Planning: Provides advanced research to introduce/integrate new processes, equipment, and technologies into the company

Who You Are:
Preferred Skills and Competencies
  • Very strong analysis skills: process, capacity, cost/benefit, waste stream, and quality tools.
  • Internal and external quality support/management
  • Knowledge in lean manufacturing techniques: flow, PQ, equipment reliability, and set up reduction.
  • Facilitation and negotiation skills
  • Knowledge of material handling
  • Productivity improvement techniques: RCI’s
  • Behavior sciences (logic, sociology, etc.)
  • Economics and financial analysis
  • Work measurement
  • Interpersonal skills
  • Computer skills; advanced level required to utilize Excel and Access programs
  • Experience in design, specification, purchase, and installation of new equipment
  • Experience in the Engineering Design Process
  • Knowledge of simulation, process modeling, and value stream mapping
  • Project management and leadership ability
  • Occupational Bio Mechanics/Human Factors Engineering
  • Strategic planning
Required Skills and Competencies
  • 4 year technical degree or equivalent education.

job.title: BIM/VDC Coordinator (34377)
job.description:
Virtual Design & Construction (VDC) Coordinator
Location: McCarran, NV
Job Type: Full-Time
About the Role:
We are seeking a Virtual Design & Construction (VDC) Coordinator to join our growing team. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys combining technology and construction, thrives in a collaborative environment, and is excited to work on large, complex projects in both public and private sectors.
As the VDC Coordinator, you will play a key role in bringing projects to life digitally before they're built — from 3D modeling and BIM coordination to supporting field teams with layout and constructability solutions.
What You'll Do:

  • Develop and manage virtual 3D models and 2D layouts.
  • Create 3D and 4D models using Revit and Plant3D.
  • Run BIM coordination meetings, track clashes, and resolve issues with subcontractors using Autodesk Construction Cloud and Navisworks.
  • Perform 3D laser scanning for on-site coordination.
  • Translate 2D drawings into accurate 3D models for field use and QA.
  • Collaborate with project managers and field staff to solve constructability issues.
  • Produce 3D logistics plans and animations for preconstruction/site planning.
  • Maintain BIM standards, templates, and software tools across the company.
  • Provide vendor/software support to the engineering team.
  • Support drone photogrammetry and drone surveys.
What We're Looking For:
  • Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction Management, or related field OR equivalent experience.
  • 4+ years of VDC/BIM experience in industrial and commercial construction.
  • Proficiency with Revit and Navisworks is a must.
  • Ability to create and manage 3D/4D models.

job.title: FPGA Engineering Manager (34482)
job.description:
FPGA Engineering Manager

Overview:
Our client is seeking an experienced FPGA Engineering Manager to lead the design and delivery of next-generation broadcast and video processing technology. This individual will oversee a multidisciplinary team of FPGA, software, and verification engineers to ensure innovation, quality, and timely delivery across complex hardware development programs. The role combines hands-on technical leadership with team management and strategic planning.

Key Responsibilities:
• Lead and mentor FPGA, software, and verification engineers through design, development, integration, and release cycles.
• Define FPGA architecture and development methodologies aligned with product and business goals.
• Drive execution of FPGA design, verification, and integration to ensure quality and performance targets are met.
• Establish and enforce best practices for design reviews, coding standards, and continuous integration workflows.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware, software, and product management, to deliver cohesive solutions.
• Evaluate new FPGA technologies, EDA tools, and verification methodologies to enhance productivity and design quality.
• Participate in technical discussions, design reviews, and planning sessions to align development with the overall technology roadmap.

Leadership & Team Management:
• Supervise engineering staff, including task planning, progress tracking, and performance reviews.
• Promote a collaborative and accountable culture focused on technical excellence and innovation.
• Support recruitment, onboarding, and professional development of technical staff.

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering (or equivalent).
• 10+ years of experience in FPGA or high-speed digital design.
• Strong background in FPGA architecture, serial interfaces, and high-speed protocols (e.g., DDR, PCIe, Ethernet, HDMI, DisplayPort, SDI).
• Proficiency with FPGA design and verification tools (Xilinx Vivado, Intel Quartus, ModelSim/QuestaSim) and scripting languages (Python, Tcl, Bash).
• Experience with lab debugging tools (oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, JTAG, etc.).
• Proven leadership in managing multidisciplinary engineering teams and driving product delivery.
• Excellent communication, organizational, and problem-solving skills.

job.title: Electrical Engineer - Substation (34462)
job.description:
Electrical Engineer - Substation
Location: Saint Louis, MO (On-site/Field)

Description
Responsible for substation engineering and consulting services for clients across the US and internationally. Main responsibilities include creating electrical protection & control and/or physical layout design deliverables. Projects range in size, complexity, and voltage class from small distribution facility upgrades to large transmission projects. This position can influence the future of the resiliency, reliability, and economic operation of the electric grid.

Responsibilities:
  • Principal responsibilities include the design of high voltage (13kV-500kV) electrical substations. Areas of design and responsibilities include leading and executing the following:
  • Preparation of proposals and scope development, including conceptual designs and execution plans.
  • Prepare engineering cost and labor estimates and schedules.
  • Physical substation design includes yard layouts, plans, sections and details, grounding, lightning protection, control building arrangements, interior and exterior raceways, auxiliary AC/DC power systems, and associated bills of material.
  • Protection and control design including panel arrangements, one lines/single lines, three lines, AC schematics, DC elementaries, equipment wiring and relay panel wiring.
  • Preparing calculations and reports for engineering studies (grounding, lightning protection, AC/DC load studies, etc.)
  • Preparing equipment specifications for procurement and/or factory acceptance testing.
  • Coordinating design activities with other departments (Civil/Structural, Networks, Transmission Line, others.)
  • Providing guidance and mentoring to less experienced team members.
  • Regularly meeting with and corresponding with clients or outside personnel.
  • Performing quality reviews for other engineers and designers.
  • Providing short term field support during construction.
  • Supporting business development and marketing initiatives.
  • Other areas of involvement may include relay settings, 3D/intelligent design, or industry/professional technical committee involvement.
  • Performing other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering or related degree from an ABET-accredited program and 3 years of electrical engineering experience, consulting preferred - OR - Bachelor’s degree in electrical or related Engineering Technology from an ABET accredited program and successful completion of Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) exam and 3 years of electrical engineering experience, consulting preferred.
  • Master’s degree in electrical engineering and 2 years of electrical engineering experience, consulting is preferred/required.
  • Strong knowledge of standard engineering techniques and procedures.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to work methodically and analytically in a quantitative problem-solving environment and demonstrated critical thinking skills.
  • Proficient in standard engineering techniques and procedures.
  • Strong computer skills. (e.g. Microsoft Office Suite)
  • Strong computer skills include AutoCAD, MicroStation, 2D and 3D rendering programs and other analysis programs.
  • Strong attention to detail, facilitation, team building, collaboration, organization and problem-solving skills.
  • Engineers in Training-EIT Certification preferred.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

job.title: Estimator - Self-Perform Substation, Senior (34392)
job.description:
Senior Estimator
Location: Houston, TX (Onsite/field)

Benefits: Access to Client Benefits Package

Description:
The Senior Estimator will be responsible for developing self-perform estimates for transmission and distribution bids, mainly for substations.  This position will develop accurate bottoms up estimates in a credible and professional manner while minimizing risk to the company.

Responsibilities:
  • Develop bottoms up estimates for transmission and distribution bids (mainly substations)
  • Focus will be mainly on high voltage scope vs. civil and foundations.
  • Develop estimate schedules to manage workload and ensure timely completion of estimates.
  • Review RFP and engineering documents.
  • Responsible for detailed documentation of quantity take-offs and constructability analysis.
  • Responsible for the accuracy and validity of estimate assumptions.
  • Develop high level project schedules (e.g. using Excel).
  • Develop risk registers and assist risk review process.
  • Review commercial terms and conditions and address risk issues.
  • Responsible for compliance with estimating methodology ensuring quality estimates are produced.
  • Lead project team review for estimating quantities and scope of project.
  • Responsible for reviewing and incorporating quotes for vendors, subcontractors, bonds and insurance.         
  • Lead subcontractor solicitation and bid reviews.
  • Review and verify subcontractor bid packages before being transmitted for quotes.
  • Responsible for reviewing and incorporating specialty and standard equipment and material quotes.
  • Estimate general conditions, indirect costs and review with project management team.
  • Responsible for the review of final estimate and presentation to management.
  • Make recommendations as to contingency and escalation.
  • Provide estimated hours for required estimating effort and review with Section Manager
  • Review and validate value engineering items, alternates and options.
  • Lead teams estimating completion of pre-construction services.
  • Responsible for updating cost history and data base management.
  • Train and mentor staff.
  • All other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Construction Management or related field and 7 years of direct project estimating experience.
  • Applicable experience may be substituted for the degree requirement.
  • Ability to work independently or in groups, think creatively and analytically, and make quick and sound decisions.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Expert with Microsoft Office, ConEst and K-base.
  • OSHA 10-hour certification required.
Preferred:
  • 4 years of self-performing substation estimating experience.
  • 8 years of experience with transmission & distribution EPC or construction contractors estimating in the field.
  • Must have extensive knowledge and experience developing estimates and bidding transmission and distribution construction work.



We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

job.title: Lead Technical Consultant (Flink / Kafka) - Must Be OnSite (3 Days) (34497)
job.description:

Required Skills & Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent discipline.

  • 10+ years of enterprise software development experience, with at least 3 years in a lead or senior technical role.

  • Deep expertise in Java, Spring Boot, Microservices, REST API development, and SQL/NoSQL data stores.

  • Proven experience with Kafka and event-driven architectures (must have).

Only candidates with fully verifiable credentials will be considered.

job.title: IS Help Desk Support Analyst (34496)
job.description:

Full-Time | Onsite |
Immediate start available
The Myticas team is actively recruiting for an experienced Help Desk Support Analyst to support and maintain end-user technology within a corporate environment. This role is 100% onsite, Monday–Friday, and will serve as the primary point of contact for diagnosing, troubleshooting, and resolving desktop hardware, software, and network issues.

Hardware Support
  • Maintain, upgrade, and troubleshoot desktops, laptops, Macs, mobile devices, and printers

  • Configure and support company-issued smartphones
General Responsibilities
  • Prioritize tickets and ensure timely resolution with strong customer service

  • Provide support to additional IT functions as needed
What You Bring
  • Associate degree in a related field or 2+ years of help desk / desktop support experience
  • Experience supporting Microsoft desktop products, Adobe, antivirus tools, VPN (Cisco), WDS, Macs, and Help Desk platforms
  • CompTIA A+, MCP, or related certifications are a plus
  • Strong communication, customer service, problem-solving, and documentation skills

Why This Opportunity
  • Competitive salary + bonus

Interested?
Apply today for immediate consideration. We are moving quickly and will be scheduling interviews right away.

  • Industry background in Mining, Oil & Gas, or Power & Utilities preferred.

  • Strong understanding of S/4HANA Finance and related master data structures.

  • Excellent stakeholder communication and leadership skills.

  • Ability to work effectively in fast-paced, client-facing project environments.
